update.description:
This version of the library should allow to publish/subscribe messages between nodes and make synchronous and asynchronous service call requests. The messages are typed and if the nodes are within the same process, no serialization should be done.

Requires: zeromq, czmq, robot_msgs, protobuf, and uuid-dev. It also requires c++11 (as probably most of the ignition projects).

Take a look at src/Node_TEST to see how to use the library while I'm writing the tutorials.

From a design point of view, these are the building blocks I've used to create a node in each process.

```
 _______   _______
|       | |       |
| Node 1| | Node 2|
|_______| |_______|
|                 |
|   Node Shared   |
|_________________|
|                 |
|     Discovery   |
|_________________|
     (Process1)
```

This is the [drone.io
job status](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_transport).

[![Build Status](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_transport/status.png)](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_transport/latest)
update.title: Initial complete version

content.raw: There is now an [ign_msgs](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_msgs) repot that replaces `robot_msgs`. The necessary changes to `ign_transport` are in the [transport_0.3.0_ign_msgs](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_transport/branch/transport_0.3.0_ign_msgs?dest=transport_0.3.0#diff)

content.raw:
Update on mac osx status:

I can build successfully on osx with the following commands:
~~~
brew tap osrf/simulation
# robot_msgs --HEAD uses c++11 branch
brew install robot_msgs --HEAD
# need to run a second time due to weird behavior related to our custom protobuf formula
brew install robot_msgs --HEAD
brew install ignition-transport --HEAD
~~~

It has a few compiler warnings. Also the tests are failing. @caguero is looking into the failing tests.

There are also a few homebrew warnings on osx 10.8 that are resolved on 10.9. This is related to libstdc++ vs. libc++ and libc++ is required for c++11.
content.html:
Update on mac osx status:

I can build successfully on osx with the following commands:

brew tap osrf/simulation
# robot_msgs --HEAD uses c++11 branch
brew install robot_msgs --HEAD
# need to run a second time due to weird behavior related to our custom protobuf formula
brew install robot_msgs --HEAD
brew install ignition-transport --HEAD

It has a few compiler warnings. Also the tests are failing. @caguero is looking into the failing tests.

There are also a few homebrew warnings on osx 10.8 that are resolved on 10.9. This is related to libstdc++ vs. libc++ and libc++ is required for c++11.

content.raw:
There is good bunch of code but I really appreciate all the tests looking for the full coverage. Yay!
I'm not able to make the tests to fail in my Linux raring system with the following dependencies:
```
--   found robot_msgs, version 0.1.0
--   found libzmq, version 4.0.4
--   found libczmq, version 2.2.1
--   found uuid, version 2.20.0
```
Nice job, next time we should think the way of making it in different PRs so the motivation for reviewing won't be so hard.
content.html:
There is good bunch of code but I really appreciate all the tests looking for the full coverage. Yay! I'm not able to make the tests to fail in my Linux raring system with the following dependencies:

--   found libczmq, version 2.2.1
--   found uuid, version 2.20.0

Nice job, next time we should think the way of making it in different PRs so the motivation for reviewing won't be so hard.

content.raw: Grrr sorry for recommending you to remove all the CPack instructions. We really don't need anything related to DEB or RMP but we are using CPack to generate our .tar.gz packages via make package_source. We need to restore this part.
content.html: Grrr sorry for recommending you to remove all the CPack instructions. We really don't need anything related to DEB or RMP but we are using CPack to generate our .tar.gz packages via make package_source. We need to restore this part.

content.html: I'll try to move robot_msgs into ignition and remove the dependency on boost.

content.raw: I just created a [pull request for removing the boost dependency](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/robot_msgs/pull-request/5/) in robot_msgs. Let me know if that solves the problem.
content.html: I just created a pull request for removing the boost dependency in robot_msgs. Let me know if that solves the problem.
